snippet: If authentic, the recording would be the first public address by Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi in six months, who had been reported injured after an airstrike.
abstract: Islamic State terrorist group releases audio statement that it claims is from its leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, who has reportedly been injured during airstrike in Iraq.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: If authentic, the recording would be the first public address by Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi in six months, who had been reported injured after an airstrike.

headline.main: ISIS Releases a Recording It Says Was Made by Its Leader
headline.print_headline: ISIS Makes Public a Recording It Says Was Made by Its Leader

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
